heading: How do tax revenues on labour and capital differ in EU countries?
subheading: In 2022, the average tax revenue-ratio on labour and capital in the EU27 was 2.29. This means that tax receipts on labour are 2.29 times higher than those on capital
textNote: The labour-to-capital ratio shows that, on average, EU countries tax labour much more than capital. Higher ratios indicate a greater dependence of public revenues on labour income and social contributions, while lower ratios indicate a more balanced or capital-oriented tax policy aimed at attracting investment.
